result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 300 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Counts 2, 3 and 4.

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Undergo a mental health evalution and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with the victims listed in the Criminal Complaint.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Christopher L Jackson in court, by phone, in custody (OTP'd from Waupun Correctional), with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.   
Court to Address:  
Oral Ruling on:     Defendant's own motion for ineffective assistance of counsel - Court to determine if there is a sufficient basis/grounds to proceed with an evidentiary/Machner hearing.
                                
                                Defense Postconviction Motion - filed by Atty. Jensen
                                (Alleging the Court had communication with the jury outside the presence of defense counsel violated Jacksons right to due process, and to assistance of counsel.  
                                Communicating with the jury outside the presence of the defendant and defense counsel violated Jacksons constitutional right to be present during all critical 2 aspects of the trial.  
                                The courts error was not harmless) - Vacate Verdict and New Trial.
                                

Court is satisfied the court had no communication with the jury outside the presence of defense counsel.
Further reasons placed on the record.
Court Denies - Atty. Jensen's Motion to Vacate the Verdict and Grant a New Trial for the reasons as placed on the record.

Court finds the Search Warrant was valid based on the record provided.
Court is satisfied there was a sufficient basis for a No Knock provision in the search warrant.
Therefore, no basis for a suppression motion on the search warrant/evidence.
Defendant has not met the threshhold issue.
Further reasons placed on the record.
Court Denies - Defendant's Motion for a Machner Hearing.

Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison: 50 Years.

Extended Supervision:  20 Years.
300 Days Credit.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by the agent.
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ;

Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victim's listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

Costs:  $268

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Andrea M Will and Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Christopher L Jackson in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco and attorney Anna Kees. 

Court back on the record @ 8:52 am.

Court addressed a jury instruction issue with the parties.
Defense presented arguments regarding a Lesser Included (First Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety) jury instruction that they are requesting.
State would just renew its previous objection arguments.
Court Denies - Defense request for a lesser included (Based on the record - No basis to include).
Reasons placed on the record.

State would like present rebuttal witnesses and presented statements to the court.
Court in a brief recess @ 9:31 am.

Court back on the record @ 9:47 am.
Defense addressed an issue regarding one of the State's rebuttal witnesses (prior arrests).
State objects and presented arguments.
Defense presented response.
Court denies - Defense request (prior arrests are no admissible).
Reasons placed on the record.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @  9:57 am.

Defense rests.

Rebuttal Witnesses Called: Laron Gooch, Detective Brad Warhanek (City of Brookfield Police Department).
Rebuttal witnesses sworn and testified.

Exhibits Offered and Received:  112, 115, 116, 117 & 118.
Exhibit 113 - Never Offered or Received.

Court deems testimony closed.

Andrea M Will and Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Christopher L Jackson in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco and attorney Anna Kees.   
Court to Address:  All Motions in Limine.

Parties did file a stipulation today in court.
State and Defense have reached an agreement on most of issues.
Stipulation has been placed on he record.

Only outstanding issues are:
State's #6 - Admissibility of Jail Calls.
Defense #7 - Admissibility of Statements.

Admissibility of Statements:
State presented arguments to the court.
Atty. Bricco presented arguments to the court.
Court finds statements are admissible.  However, some portions may not be admissible - Not relevant.
Court finds prior convictions are admissible - however, specific of that conviction are not admissible.

Admissibility of Jail Calls:
State presented arguments to the court.
Atty. Bricco presented arguments to the court.
Court finds the Jail Calls are admissible.  Reasons placed on the record.

Ad Prosequendum.
